definition: in a few words (idiom); expressed succinctly
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

sentences.english: Closed questions can be answered in a few words or sentences.
sentences.chinese: 封閉式問題可以用三言兩語進行解答。

sentences.english: The rule of this game is too complicated to explain clearly in a few words.
sentences.chinese: 這個遊戲的規則太複雜，三言兩語解釋不清。

sentences.english: It can be summed up in two words.
sentences.chinese: 這可以用三言兩語概括起來。

sentences.english: There was the captain curtly pleading as before.
sentences.chinese: 上尉還在那裏像先前一樣三言兩語地懇求着。

sentences.english: She disposed of the arguments against her plan in two sentences .
sentences.chinese: 她用三言兩語就駁倒了反對她的計劃的論點。

sentences.english: He was sketchiest in broad-brushing his goals in the new policy.
sentences.chinese: 他用三言兩語勾畫了新政策的目標。
